sentences: Raskelt saadud tarkus on kõige väärtuslikum.
context: The Estonian adverb 'raskelt' has multiple meanings depending on context. It can mean: 1) heavily/with weight - describing physical weight or impact; 2) with difficulty/difficultly - when referring to effort or struggle; 3) seriously/severely - regarding health conditions or seriousness of matters; 4) slowly/laboriously - describing movement that is not fluid. The word modifies verbs to indicate how an action is performed, often implying some form of weight, difficulty, or severity.
